website_summaries.verdict: Small crib works great for newborns, and it also converts to a twin-size bed frame when child is older.
pros: Safe all-wood materials in the crib, including CARB II compliant wood that's lead and phthalate safe
Smart conversion option to twin-size bed frame
Nice option as an extra crib for the parents' bedroom for fussy babies
cons: Some odors may be noticeable from the mattress support fiber board

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Mini Crib
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for our master bedroom/nursery combo. It fits perfectly in the designated space for our baby boy. Assembly seemed to be easy. My husband assembled the crib himself and it took less than a hour. The color & finish are perfect. The crib is also very sturdy. Great for the price!! I’m happy!!
customer_reviews.author: Veteran Wife

customer_reviews.title: Great for small spaces!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for small spaces! Our boy was outgrowing his rock n play but most cribs were too big for our space. This beautiful crib works perfectly! It is well made and I like how I don't have to bend all the way to over to place him in it (as was the case with the pack n play). I followed other reviewers advice and purchased the Dream on Me 3 mini mattress and Carter's Easy Fit portable crib sheet. Both work well!
customer_reviews.author: baltimoremama3324

customer_reviews.title: Great long-term solution for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: Originally got this because we had limited space in our apartment. But we’re still using it after we moved and our son is now 2. He’s in the 75% for length and still fits, though I suspect in the next 6 months he may be too long to fully lay down. BUT the lowest setting for the mattress is low enough that he is still unable to climb/fall out. The top rail reaches the top of his shoulders. It’s very light weight and easy to move from room to room (both alone and with help). The light weight wood does, however, make it easily scratched/dented so you need to be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Karen W

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small spaces but get a different mattress
customer_reviews.text: I love this crib so much. It’s little and cute and sturdy! Wasn’t too difficult to assemble, I’ve never put together a crib before and didn’t struggle too much. The instructions don’t have many words though, mostly just pictures, and the hardware all comes in one bag so none of the pieces are labeled. There were a few knicks and scratches from the manufacturer but nothing too concerning. It does come with a mattress pad but it’s very thin, like a changing table pad, I recommend buying a mini crib mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Kirstie

customer_reviews.title: We love it!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this (along with the thicker mattress) for my parents house. Were there a lot and a pack n play wasn't cutting it for our baby to get a good night's sleep. It takes up less space then a full crib so fits nicely in the guest room even with the rest of the furniture. My baby definitely slept comfortably and the crib looks nice in the room!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Kinney

customer_reviews.title: Missing critical piece
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful crib for an affordable price. Perfect size for our little home. Easy to assemble, but husband was unable to fully secure the front rail to a screw on one side due to the railing not being built with the pre-installed threaded anchor that the screw would go into. I have no idea what that piece is called. I have contacted customer service two times and they are very responsive, but have sent the incorrect parts on two different occasions. I dont think I can ask for a replacement front railing to be sent. This has already been drawn out for over 3+ weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Scottf

customer_reviews.title: I am Very disappointed !!!
customer_reviews.text: I received a mini crib for the first time, it was a lot of defects and cracks, very cheap quality. Of course I sent it back. asked for an exchange, they sent me again a defective option and even worse, look at the photo, in the photo the legs of the crib are completely different to the description . Please look at pictures I am very disappointed .
customer_reviews.author: Dasha

customer_reviews.title: Love love love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect! My toddler is still in the crib and I didn’t want to transition him out or buy another crib. I looked at pack n plays, bassinets and mini cribs. So happy I went with the mini crib! The size is perfect in my room and can be right up next to the bed. It’s sturdy and I was able to put it together on my own, no help from husband! Highly recommend this for anyone needing to save space, or wanting to buy one thing for baby to sleep in, instead of a standard crib and a bedside bassinet/ pack n play.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Newton

customer_reviews.title: Ok but arrived with damaged parts
customer_reviews.text: The instructions aren't that easy to follow. The illustrations are not accurate on some joints and parts to use. I eventually figured it out but took way longer (2.5 hours) than expected. I've put together loads of IKEA furniture and consider myself a decent handyman. The finish is good. The mattress pad came ripped so I reached out to the seller and they have promised to send a replacement in 6 weeks ( :( ) after sending a bunch of pics of damaged product. So the newborn can't use it until that arrives, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Vimal

customer_reviews.title: Not for those with back pain
customer_reviews.text: Really not a fan of this product, if you have a bad back like me this will absolutely hurt it. The most basic crib function of the front sliding lower to get baby out easier does noy exist on this, and the highest tier the mattress sits is so far down low that you are constantly bending at the hip to pick baby up, while leaning against the rail that doesn't slide down. This adds up to an impossibly painful lower back that does not go away. Very poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Great looking crib but you definitely need a separate mattress
customer_reviews.text: It's a beautiful crib, took some time to assemble. The hardest part is the mattress holder. It is light weight- I have easily moved it from one room to another, yet very sturdy. It is difficult to move the mattress down each time. The pad that came with it was damaged, by the time I looked at it I had already assembled the crib and wasn't going to take it apart to return it, so I jsut kept it. I had already bought a separate mattress for it and that's been working fine.
customer_reviews.author: numi

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase so far
customer_reviews.text: Nice crib to have in the master bedroom. It looks great and is a great small size. It seems to be put together well. Myself and teenager were able to easily put it together. It does seem to on the softer side of wood. I am curious how it will hold up, but so far I am happy with it and looking forward to using this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: K. Fitz

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this mini crib!

My son is 15 months currently and fits great in it. I bought a different mattress (5inch) thick and it’s perfect. No gaps in between and very well made and sturdy.

customer_reviews.title: Best Mini Crib to Purchase

This crib fits perfectly inside with a six cubicle shelf, rug, laundry basket and his clothes. Only took about 1.5 to put together and it was just me. Love it.

customer_reviews.title: Just the perfect size!

I agree with a previous reviewer that the finish is easy to scratch, I marked it up a bit by accident just getting the stickers off of it.

Overall, I would definitely recommend this over a regular crib.
